chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Steen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 29 days sentence credit.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

RESTITUTION STAYED:  DEFENDANT REQUESTED A RESTITUTION HEARING.  $10,224.87 to be paid to the victim listed in the criminal complaint (to be paid within the first 18 months of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines).

AMENDED 02-26-2015:  Restitution of $10,224.87 is to be paid to the Victim listed in the criminal complaint to be paid as a Condition of Probation or as a Condition of Extended Supervision if defendant's probation is revoked.  Restitution to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 12-04-2014.
Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 60 DAYS:  Non-working hours with all standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 12-07-2014.  Court will allow condition time to be served in Milwaukee County, if accepted.
LAST 60 DAYS STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott A Steen in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  
Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for restitution hearing.
State advised court that the parties have stipulated to restitution.
Attorney Rosario advised court that the defendant has agreed to the restitution amount of $10,224.87.
Defendant is in agreement of the restitution amount.

Court orders restitution as follows:

RESTITUTION:  $10,224.87 to be paid to the Victim listed in the criminal complaint to be paid as a condition of Probation or as a condition of extended supervison if defendant's probation revoked. If restitution still owing after sentence completed, then restitution to be converted to a civil judgment.
- Restitution to be paid before costs or fines.

Amended Judgment of Conviction to be done and copies provided to all parties.

Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Scott A Steen in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  
State has complied with victim notification.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 4 Years
Initial Confinement: 2 Years
Extended Supervision: 2 Years
29 Days Credit
Stayed

If Revoked:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to contact D.O.C. by 9:00 a.m. tomorrow - 12/04/14.

RESTITUTION:  $10,224.87 (to be paid to the Victim listed in the criminal complaint  (to be paid within the first 18 Months of Probation)- restitution to be paid before costs or fines);  DEFENDANT REQUESTED A RESTITUTION HEARING
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation

CONDITION TIME: 
120  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, including treatment and counseling)
Last 60 days -STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.   
Defendant to report to the Huber facility no later then 6:00 p.m. on:  12/07/14
Court will allow condition time to be served in Milwaukee County if they are willing to take him.
